item.title: Report E-2024040045
item.description:
Report E-2024040045

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-01
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Dallas, TX. The spill consists of approximately 1 gallon of Unisol Liquid Red B (UN1307), which released from a 55 gallon metal drum due to a piece of metal from the trailer puncturing the bottom of the drum, causing a slow leak onto the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, who stated they will clean the spill with absorbent, and will place the contents into an 85 gallon metal drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040002
item.description:
Report E-2024040002

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-03T15:11:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: SANGER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 26, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured by a forklift and released approximately thirty (30) gallons of product to the trailer interior and one (1) gallon to the underneath of the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH patched the metal drum and placed it into one (1) 95-gallon poly overpacked drum. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the interior of the trailer and pavement below to absorb the paint. LSH swept all paint impacted absorbents with hand tools and containerized them to one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. Utilizing degreaser, LSH wiped off impacted surfaces of the cargo shipment and contained all remaining debris absorbent pads and utilized PPE into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. LSH generated two (2) 55-gallon poly drums worth of non-hazardous waste, and one (1) 95- gallon overpacked poly drum of hazardous waste. All waste generated was labeled appropriately and staged onsite for further handling.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 20 ounces of CARBOTHANE 8815 PART A released from a 5-gallon metal drum due to a pinhole puncture in the bottom rim. The release impacted the concrete dock and pallet. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with the PPE available on site.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The pkg was loaded correctly, but no inner packaging. No inner packaging allowed a continuously small leak. At time of discovery, the pkg was removed immediately from work areas and transported in a lined hazardous tote to the hazardous material processing area. DescribePack: one bottle had a very loose closure and was bent and crushed a bit. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The pkg was immediately removed from working areas.

DescribePack: 2 one gallon cans and 2 quart sized cans were in the box, all soiled by grey paint. Packing listed the following 3 part numbers, SUM-LVSP422G, SUM-LVSP314G, and SUM-LVSH320Q. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Leakage was not spreading. Box was wrapped in a bag when found and was moved to Hazmat cage.

DescribePack: Upon inspection, 2 of the 4 one gallon bottles were bubbling near the cap. Both felt more than half full. Others were partly wet due to the leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was upright when found. Leakage was not spreading. Box was placed in a tote lined with a Hazmat bag when moved to Hazmat cage.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1. X-2024031299 SequenceEvent: Package was found wet coming down the conveyor belt on load side of hub. Package was then moved to Hazmat cage for inspection. DescribePack: Jerrican is still mostly full and no significant leakage was found, only small streaks coming down the side. A small drip comes from the closure when the container is turned sideways. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a salvage drum when removed from loading dock. 2. X-2024031305 SequenceEvent: Pkg was unloaded from trailer. Pkg was already leaking from corner indicating package was damaged. Pkg was given to QA to further process DescribePack: Corner side of box was disintegrated, leaking from gallon inside DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Pkg was quickly handled and put in a Hazmat bag

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found to be leaking on load side 3 by door 151. QA hazmat was called. Upon arrival the package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and returned to the hazmat cage. Spill pads were placed down to prevent injury. DescribePack: The package appears to have been dropped onto something sharp/pointy which punctured the bottom of the item. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and returned to the hazmat cage. Spill pads were placed down to prevent injury.

Bottles were mostly dry. Each was examined carefully and no active leakage could be found. A wet spot was seen on the bottom of one bottle. A test strip was applied and part of the strip indicated a pH12 color. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was placed in a tote for transport to Hazmat cage and then in a drum for inspection.

item.title: Report X-2024031262
item.description:
Report X-2024031262

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: SPRING
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Internal leak noticed during the unloading process. package was inadequately packed for Trasport. package was removed from sortation for inspection and processing. DescribePack: loose cap/ packed upside-down counter to the orientation arrows. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: caps tightened, positioned upright.

item.title: Report X-2024031168
item.description:
Report X-2024031168

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-19
  • City: VICTORIA
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler was inbound scanning trailer 571968 when she found the leaking hazmat 4 walls into the 53ft trailer. Upon discovery she informed management which called for a damaged hazmat over the radio. QA arrived and placed the leaking package into a hazardous materials only tote and removed it from the unload to the hazmat cage for further inspection. Upon inspection it was found that 1 of the gallon glass jugs had shattered in shipping causing the box to be completely saturated. DescribePack: 1 gallon glass jug completely shattered due to inadequate bracing inside of the package. The only bracing protection was cardboard slotted partitions above and below the glass jugs. Hazmat package was incorrectly loaded into trailer, being located 4 walls into it. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was placed into a hazardous materials only tote and removed from unload to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024031198
item.description:
Report X-2024031198

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-04
  • City: PFLUGERVILLE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking white granules on the IC belt near belt 4. The belt was stopped and the package was transfered to a hazmat bag lined hazmat tote, and the ic belt was cleaned with latex gloves and a dust pan. Upon inspection the plastic drum had cracked along the side and leaked around 5lbs of the calcium hypochlorite granules. DescribePack: The drum cracked along the side at around 7 inches. the crack was thin and in a straight line from the top to middle area of the drum. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The release was mitigated by the IC belt being stopped and the hazmat being contained in a hazmat bag to catch any further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024031199
item.description:
Report X-2024031199

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-04
  • City: PFLUGERVILLE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: X-2024031199: SequenceEvent: The package developed an odor and had some evidence of leakage after being transported to van line 1. The package was contained by the qa working van line 1 and the leakage was confined to the cardboard box. DescribePack: the twistable cap located on the top of the 5 gallon metal drum had been bent and can no longer contain the acetone liquid inside. there is no longer a seal with the cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: due to the strong odor of the acetone liquid the hazmat was found quickly and placed in a hazmat bag before the liquid escaped the cardboard overpack X-2024031237: SequenceEvent: The package began emitting an odor after being transported to van line 1 around 6:00 AM. The qa for van line 1 contained the hazmat package in a hazmat bag and hazmat tote. Upon inspection it was found that the cap had been bent and could no longer form a complete seal. DescribePack: the cap of the metal drum had been bent and could no longer form a complete seal and the methyl ethyl ketone liquid was able to leak from it DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: due to the strong odor of the methy ethyl ketone liquid contained inside, the package was found quickly and transfered to a hazmat bag and tote before the liquid could escape the cardboard outer pack
